comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: this should be be the Principe Di Udine, arriving from Genoa on this date, 2 Vanderbilts were listed on the manifest, her initials are L. N. in the manifest. www.ellisisland.org/shipping/FormatTripPass.asp?sship=Pri...

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: A son of William Henry Vanderbilt, Frederick [William] Vanderbilt graduated in 1876 from Yale University's Sheffield Scientific School, to which he donated $500,000 in 1902. In 1878 he married Louise Holmes Anthony Torrance. Though they were unable to have children, they had a close relationship with their nieces and nephews.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29079609@N02] You can see "...PE DI UDINE" on the life saver at the right of the photo. Good call.
